title: Habikino
text:
is a <a href="Cities%20of%20Japan">city</a> located in Eastern <a href="Osaka%20Prefecture">Osaka Prefecture</a>, <a href="Japan">Japan</a>. It is particularly well known for its <a href="grape">grape</a> production, as well as the many <a href="kofun">ancient burial mounds</a> that dot its landscape. The city was founded on January 15, 1959. As of February 28, 2017, the city has an estimated <a href="population">population</a> of 113,256 and a <a href="population%20density">population density</a> of 4,300 persons per km². The total area is 26.44 km².
Education.
Universities and technical schools.
All of Primary and Secondary schools are public.
Transportation.
Roads.
National toll roads.
Minami-Hanna Expressway (two interchanges within city limits):
Historical Place.
<a href="Furuichi%20kofungun">Furuichi Kofungun</a>, a group of "<a href="Kofun">Kofun</a>", includes some kofun in Habikino. They are recorded as <a href="World%20Heritage%20Site">World Heritage Site</a>s.
